item.title: "Those Who Speak Truth...": Yogi Adityanath On High Court Judge's Remarks - NDTV
item.description:
Those Who Speak Truth...: Yogi Adityanath On High Court Judge's Remarks

Publication Date: October 28, 2024

Source: NDTV

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticized the Opposition for their impeachment motions against key figures, claiming those who speak the truth face threats and expressing his grievances against Congress.

  • Adityanath expressed concern over impeachment notices against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar and Allahabad High Court Judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav.
  • He accused Congress of double standards and suppressing the truth.
  • The Chief Minister defended the need for a Uniform Civil Code, referencing the judge's comments supporting it.
  • He mentioned India's potential growth, claiming it will become the third largest economy by 2027.
  • Adityanath emphasized the importance of India's cultural legacy in economic development.
"Whoever speaks the truth, these people will pressurise him with impeachment (motions), and still they talk about the Constitution." - Yogi Adityanath

Adityanath's remarks underline the contentious political landscape and the ongoing debates around India's legal and cultural frameworks, as he calls for recognition and support for those who express their views freely.

item.title: Bihar Police BPSSC Steno Assistant Sub Inspector ASI Online Form 2024 - SarkariExam.com
item.description:
Bihar Police BPSSC Steno Assistant Sub Inspector ASI Online Form 2024

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Bihar Police Subordinate Services Commission (BPSSC)

Introduction: The Bihar Police Subordinate Services Commission has announced the recruitment for 305 Assistant Sub Inspector (Steno) posts. The online application process commenced on December 17, 2024, and will close on January 17, 2025.

  • Notification Date: December 14, 2024
  • Application Start Date: December 17, 2024
  • Last Date to Apply: January 17, 2025
  • Exam Date: To be notified soon
  • Application Fee: Rs. 700 for General, EBC, BC, EWS; Rs. 400 for SC, ST, PH
  • Minimum Age: 18 years; Maximum Age varies by category (UR/EWS: 25, BC/EBC: 27/28, SC/ST: 30)
  • Total Vacancies: 305
  • Educational Qualification: 12th pass and a 1-year diploma in Computer
Important Note: All candidates must read the official notification before applying.

Conclusion: Interested candidates are encouraged to apply online as per the guidelines provided by the BPSSC before the deadline.

item.title: ‘Double maths period, boring’: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on PM Modi's parliament speech - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Double maths period, boring’: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on PM Modi's parliament speech

Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent speech in Parliament, describing it as unoriginal and boring, likening the experience to a tedious double mathematics class.

  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra called PM Modi's address “double period of mathematics” and “boring”.
  • She expressed disappointment, stating there was nothing new in his remarks.
  • During the speech, PM Modi accused the Nehru-Gandhi family of undermining the Constitution throughout their rule.
  • Modi emphasized that the Congress family's actions during their governance have had lasting negative impacts on Indian democracy.
  • The Prime Minister recalled serious events, such as the Emergency, to highlight Congress's historical failures.
“(JP) Nadda ji was also rubbing hands but as soon as Modi ji looked at him, he started acting as if he is listening attentively. Amit Shah also had his hand on head, (Piyush) Goyal ji was going off to sleep... I had thought that the PM will say something new, something nice.” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

The exchanges in Parliament highlight ongoing tensions between the ruling party and the opposition, reflecting broader debates about governance and historical accountability in India.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Constituent Assembly wanted Uniform Civil Code to be implemented: PM Modi in Lok Sabha - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Constituent Assembly wanted Uniform Civil Code to be implemented: PM Modi in Lok Sabha

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the importance of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) during a speech in the Lok Sabha, highlighting its advocacy by BR Ambedkar and the Constituent Assembly's desire for its implementation.

  • Modi stated that the Constituent Assembly discussed UCC extensively, urging an elected government to implement it.
  • He reiterated the Supreme Court's support for bringing UCC into effect, aligning it with the spirit of the Constitution.
  • The UCC aims to standardize personal laws across all religions, covering issues like marriage and inheritance.
  • The BJP and its affiliates have consistently advocated for the UCC's implementation as a common civil framework.
  • Modi's remarks came during the celebration of 75 years since the adoption of the Constitution.
“...Uniform Civil Code - this topic was not beyond the attention of the Constituent Assembly. The Constituent Assembly discussed UCC at length…” - PM Modi
“For all of us, for all citizens and all democracy-loving citizens across the world, this is a moment of great pride.” - PM Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi's address reaffirmed the ongoing commitment to implement the UCC in India, reflecting a broader aim of unification and reform in personal law across diverse religious communities.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session highlights: PM Modi proposes 11 resolutions in Lok Sabha speech - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session highlights: PM Modi proposes 11 resolutions in Lok Sabha speech

Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 11 resolutions aimed at upholding constitutional values and addressing various social issues, while engaging in a debate around the Constitution on its 75th anniversary.

  • The Lok Sabha conducted a special debate commemorating the 75th anniversary of the Constitution.
  • Modi proposed 11 resolutions, including calls for duty fulfillment by citizens and government, zero tolerance towards corruption, and respect for the Constitution.
  • Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra made her maiden speech, critiquing the government on various fronts.
  • Modi emphasized that his government’s principle of “Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas” (Together with all, Development for all) extends beyond mere rhetoric, citing lifting of 25 crore people out of poverty.
“The 75-year-long journey is a memorable one,” PM Modi emphasized during his address.

Modi's proposals reflect an intention to reinforce national unity and inclusive growth while addressing controversies surrounding previous governments and policies.

item.title: Change in train services on Dec 14 due to water logging in Thoothukudi yard; check details here - DTNEXT
item.description:
Change in train services on Dec 14 due to water logging in Thoothukudi yard; check details here

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Not specified

In view of water logging in Thoothukudi Railway Station Yard, Southern Railway has made several changes in the pattern of services of trains operated on Saturday.

  • Train No 12694 Tuticorin - Chennai Egmore Pearl City Express will now depart from Milavittan Railway at 8.25 pm.
  • Train No 16791 Tuticorin - Palakkad Palaruvi Express will now depart from Milavittan Railway at 10 pm.
  • Train No 16766 Tuticorin - Mettupalayam Express will now depart from Milavittan Railway at 10.50 pm.
  • Train No 06667 Tuticorin - Tirunelveli Passenger departing at 6.25 pm will be fully cancelled.
  • Train No 06847 Tuticorin - Vanchi Maniyachchi Passenger departing at 10.30 pm will be fully cancelled.
  • Train No 06672 Vanchi Maniyachchi - Tuticorin Passenger departing at 8.25 pm on December 14 will be fully cancelled.

Note: Changes are due to water logging affecting operations.

item.title: PM Modi's big attack on Cong over Emergency: ‘Constitution was torn apart, India turned into jail’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi's big attack on Cong over Emergency: ‘Constitution was torn apart, India turned into jail’

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Congress party over the imposition of Emergency in 1975, stating that it severely damaged the Constitution and civil liberties in India.

  • Modi referred to the Emergency as a time when "the Constitution was torn apart" and civil rights were suppressed.
  • He claimed that under Congress rule, "all rights of the citizens were snatched" and there was significant media censorship.
  • The Prime Minister specifically targeted the Gandhi family for their role in undermining the Constitution.
  • He praised India's journey since the adoption of the Constitution, calling it "extraordinary" and emphasizing India as the "Mother of Democracy."
  • Modi acknowledged the contributions of the Constitution makers and highlighted women's voting rights as a notable achievement.
“The Constitution was torn apart when it was completing 25 years; the Emergency was imposed (in 1975), all constitutional rights were snatched and the country was turned into a jail.” - PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, Modi's statements reinforce the narrative of the Congress party's failures during the Emergency, while also celebrating the values and journey of Indian democracy since the Constitution's adoption.

item.title: Two power centres are recipe for disaster, says J-K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Two power centres are recipe for disaster, says J-K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2023 | Source: Greater Kashmir

Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has criticized the dual governance model in the region, claiming it is a “recipe for disaster” and urging the restoration of statehood.

  • Abdullah voiced concerns over the current governance structure, sharing power with the lieutenant governor.
  • He highlighted the need for a unified leadership in Jammu and Kashmir, drawing parallels with successful organizational structures.
  • The Chief Minister mentioned that there have been no benefits to governance since the region became a Union Territory.
  • He cited past promises made by the Prime Minister and Home Minister regarding the restoration of statehood, urging the Centre to fulfill these commitments.
  • Abdullah indicated that the decision to restore statehood lies with the Prime Minister and Home Minister.
  • The Chief Minister noted that the Supreme Court's intervention enabled elections in Jammu and Kashmir but was less definitive about the timeline for statehood restoration.
“Let me just say this, having two power centres anywhere is a recipe for disaster… No organisation works well if there are multiple power centres.”

In conclusion, Abdullah’s remarks reflect a call for a more straightforward governance model and a reminder of political promises made to the people of Jammu and Kashmir regarding their status and rights.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session LIVE: BJP says ‘Rahul Gandhi insulted Constitution when he tore UPA bill’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session LIVE: PM Modi to address Lok Sabha shortly

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Parliament Winter Session is underway, with Prime Minister Modi set to address the Lok Sabha shortly amidst ongoing debates on the Constitution's 75th anniversary. Various members of the opposition have been vocal about their concerns during this special session.

  • PM Modi will speak on the second and final day of the Constitution debate initiated in Lok Sabha.
  • Priyanka Gandhi Vadra made her maiden speech criticizing the ruling government on multiple issues.
  • The opposition has been vocal in defending the Constitution and criticizing the BJP's policies.
  • Congress members protested the alleged vandalization of a replica of the Constitution.
  • The Winter Session began in November and will conclude on December 20.
“The Constitution is the protective shield of justice, unity, and freedom of expression.” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

The session highlights intense political exchanges and critical discussions on the Constitution, emphasizing the significance of democratic values in India. Prime Minister Modi's upcoming address is highly anticipated amidst this heated political environment.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: After Atul Subhash, Bengaluru Cop Dies By Suicide In Uniform, Blames Wife For Torture In Note - News18
item.description:
After Atul Subhash, Bengaluru Cop Dies By Suicide In Uniform, Blames Wife For Torture In Note

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 19:37 IST

Source: News18

A Bengaluru Police constable died by suicide in uniform, citing torture from his wife and in-laws in a note. This incident follows nationwide outrage over a similar case involving techie Atul Subhash.

  • The cop, identified as HC Thippanna, 34, allegedly took his life due to ongoing domestic issues.
  • He committed suicide on the railway tracks and left behind a note blaming his wife and father-in-law for his troubles.
  • Thippanna described being threatened by his father-in-law and expressed feelings of hopelessness.
  • This tragedy is linked to recent discussions around the Atul Subhash suicide case, which has sparked debates on men's rights.
  • Social media has seen a rise in discussions advocating for justice and men's rights following these incidents.
“On December 12, he called me at 7.26 p.m., spoke for 14 minutes, and threatened me,” Thippanna wrote in his note, highlighting the distress he faced.

This tragedy underscores the need for awareness and support regarding mental health and domestic issues.

item.title: Congress must earn its place in INDIA, not take it for granted, says Omar Abdullah - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress must earn its place in INDIA, not take it for granted, says Omar Abdullah

Published Date: December 14, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Omar Abdullah, Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir, calls on the Congress party to justify its leadership in the INDIA bloc amid growing discontent from alliance partners.

  • Abdullah urges Congress to earn its leadership role rather than take it for granted.
  • He emphasizes the need for sustained engagement within the INDIA bloc beyond election cycles.
  • Abdullah acknowledges Congress’s significant position but highlights that leadership must be justified.
  • He praises Sonia Gandhi’s leadership role in the opposition alliance.
  • Concerns arise regarding the Congress's performance in past elections and its commitment within the alliance.
  • Abdullah discusses the importance of structured communication among alliance members.
  • He notes that Congress's future participation in Jammu and Kashmir governance is contingent on the restoration of Statehood.
“The Congress needs to critically examine its strike rate and learn lessons applicable to future elections.” - Omar Abdullah

In conclusion, Abdullah's remarks reflect increasing tensions and the necessity for the Congress to actively engage with its allies in order to maintain its leadership role and influence within the opposition coalition.

item.title: Two power centres are recipe for disaster: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah - The Hindu
item.description:
Two power centres are recipe for disaster: J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

Publication Date: December 14, 2024 04:55 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah describes the dual governance model in J&K as a “recipe for disaster” and urges the central government to restore statehood to the region.

  • Abdullah expresses optimism about statehood restoration, citing promises from PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah.
  • He criticizes the dual power structure, paralleling it with the ineffectiveness of businesses with multiple leaders.
  • Abdullah highlights no benefits observed since J&K became a Union Territory in 2019, calling for a unified leadership.
  • He notes the Supreme Court's role in facilitating elections but criticizes its vagueness on restoring statehood.
  • Abdullah stresses that the final decision on statehood restoration lies with the Prime Minister and Home Minister.
“Let me just say this, having two power centres anywhere is a recipe for disaster... No organisation works well if there are multiple power centres...” – Omar Abdullah

In conclusion, Abdullah's remarks underline the need for a singular leadership approach in governance and the urgency of restoring statehood for effective administration in Jammu and Kashmir.

item.title: Farmers Announce 'Rail Roko' In Punjab After 17 Protestors Injured During March To Delhi | Updates - News18
item.description:
Farmers Announce 'Rail Roko' In Punjab After 17 Protestors Injured During March To Delhi | Updates

Date: December 14, 2024   |   Source: News18

The protesting farmers suspended their march to Delhi after 17 of them sustained injuries due to police action at the Haryana-Punjab border. A tractor march and a "Rail Roko" protest have been announced for December 16 and 18 respectively.

  • Farmers' march was stopped after violent clashes with police at Shambhu border.
  • A tractor march is planned on December 16, followed by a "Rail Roko" protest in Punjab on December 18.
  • 17 farmers were injured during the march attempts, with one reported to have lost hearing due to police action.
  • Internet services have been suspended in parts of Ambala until December 17 to prevent further protests.

“Every hour, 2-3 farmers or labourers are committing suicide. We cannot leave them in this state... Our fight is for justice, and if sacrifices are needed, we are ready," said farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions between farmers and the government over agrarian issues, emphasizing the need for dialogue and resolution to prevent further escalation.

item.title: "Live-In Partner's Taunts...": Unemployed Engineer Dies By Suicide In Noida - NDTV
item.description:
Live-In Partner's Taunts...: Unemployed Engineer Dies By Suicide In Noida

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

A 27-year-old engineer in Noida has reportedly died by suicide, citing mental stress related to unemployment and taunting from his live-in partner in a note he left behind.

  • The engineer, Mayank Chandel, faced increasing stress due to his joblessness and taunts from his partner.
  • Chandel and his partner were in a live-in relationship for four years and lived together near Shaurya Banquet Hall in Noida.
  • His partner found him hanging in their apartment after returning home from work.
  • The police have initiated an investigation and sent the body for post-mortem.
"He mentioned in his note that his partner repeatedly hinted at his need to find a job, which added to his stress."

This tragic incident highlights the severe impact of mental health issues and the pressures related to employment instability. Authorities continue to investigate the circumstances surrounding Chandel's death while offering support to his family.

item.title: Congress vs BJP as Rahul invokes Savarkar during constitution debate; Kiren Rijiju hits back with Indira Gandhi's praise | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Congress vs BJP as Rahul invokes Savarkar during constitution debate; Kiren Rijiju hits back with Indira Gandhi’s praise

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: Live Mint

In a heated parliamentary debate, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi referenced Veer Savarkar, prompting a strong rebuttal from BJP leaders, who cited historical praise from Indira Gandhi to support their arguments.

  • Rahul Gandhi invoked the story of 'Eklavya' to illustrate his point during the debate.
  • Kiren Rijiju shared a document on social media where Indira Gandhi referred to Savarkar as a "remarkable son of India."
  • BJP leaders challenged the opposition's knowledge of the Constitution, with Anurag Thakur asking them to identify how many pages it contains.
  • Jagdambika Pal criticized Rahul Gandhi for previously tearing up a bill during his own government's tenure.
This document is for Rahul Gandhi Ji as he made an incorrect statement in Lok Sabha about Veer Savarkar. Indira Gandhi. — Kiren Rijiju (@KirenRijiju) December 14, 2024

The ongoing political discourse underscores the contentious debate over historical figures and their relevance in contemporary political discussions in India.

item.title: Is it Pakistan border?: Bajrang Punia on police-farmers standoff at Shambhu - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Is it Pakistan border?: Bajrang Punia on police-farmers standoff at Shambhu

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses a standoff between farmers and police at the Shambhu border where Congress leader Bajrang Punia criticized the police's use of tear gas and compared the situation to a border conflict with Pakistan.

  • Farmers have suspended their march after a confrontation with police.
  • Bajrang Punia questioned the police's actions and the government's stance on farmers' protests.
  • Seventeen to eighteen individuals were reported injured during the clash.
  • Punia urged the government to fulfill its promises regarding Minimum Support Prices (MSP) for crops.
  • The farmers attempted to march to Delhi but were blocked by police.
“On one hand, the government is saying that we are not stopping the farmers, but on the other hand, they are using tear gas and other things. It is being treated as if it is the Pakistan border.” - Bajrang Punia

The situation at the Shambhu border highlights ongoing tensions between farmers advocating for their rights and police enforcing government directives, suggesting deeper issues within agricultural policies and farmer welfare in India.

item.title: Switzerland Suspends MFN Status To India: What It Means For Stock Market Investors? - News18
item.description:
Switzerland Suspends MFN Status To India: What It Means For Stock Market Investors?

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: News18

Switzerland's recent suspension of the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) status for India poses challenges for Indian companies, particularly in finance, pharmaceuticals, and IT sectors, affecting trade dynamics between the two nations.

  • The MFN suspension disrupts the preferential trade framework under WTO rules for Indian firms.
  • Indian companies will now incur a 10% tax on dividends and incomes in Switzerland, up from 5%, effective January 1, 2025.
  • The change may lead to higher tariffs and reduced market access for Indian goods in Switzerland.
  • The Indian government anticipates renegotiating its double taxation treaty with Switzerland due to changes in trade agreements.
  • In FY 2023-24, bilateral trade reached approximately $23.76 billion, with a significant portion being imports from Switzerland.
“Investors need to keep an eye on sectors like pharmaceuticals, IT, financial services, and engineering goods.” - Stock Market Analyst

The suspension of MFN status necessitates adaptability among Indian investors and firms, as they navigate new tax implications and trade barriers in the Swiss market.

item.title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi's 'Yuva' Slip-Up In Lok Sabha Leaves Union Ministers In Splits - Times Now
item.description:
Watch: Rahul Gandhi's 'Yuva' Slip-Up In Lok Sabha Leaves Union Ministers In Splits

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: Times Now

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's recent speech in Lok Sabha sparked laughter among ministers when he mistakenly referred to a seven-year-old child as "Yuva" while discussing Eklavya from the Mahabharata.

  • Rahul Gandhi made a gaffe while referencing the story of Dronacharya and Eklavya.
  • The term "Yuva" caused amusement among BJP ministers, including Union Ministers Ashwini Vaishnaw and Kirren Rijiju.
  • He drew parallels between Eklavya's plight and the challenges faced by today's youth, particularly regarding exam preparations and paper leaks.
  • Gandhi criticized the government for privatizing key national assets, claiming it harms entrepreneurs and fair business practices.
  • He also referenced comments by VD Savarkar regarding India's Constitution.
"The manner in which Dronacharya cut off the thumb of Eklavya, you are busy cutting off the thumb of the entire nation... When you hand over Dharavi to Adani, you cut off the thumb of entrepreneurs."

Rahul Gandhi's speech not only highlighted his concerns for the youth but also criticized the government's economic policies, drawing attention to historical and contemporary issues.

item.title: Atul Subhash suicide: Estranged wife, family move Allahabad High Court for anticipatory bail - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Atul Subhash suicide: Estranged wife, family move Allahabad High Court for anticipatory bail

Published on: 14 Dec 2024, 10:10 am

Days after Bengaluru techie Atul Subhash died by suicide, his estranged wife Nikita Singhania and her family members have approached the Allahabad High Court seeking anticipatory bail in the abetment of suicide case lodged against them in Bengaluru.

  • Nikita Singhania, her mother Nisha, brother Anurag, and uncle Sushil filed the anticipatory bail plea on December 13.
  • The case will be heard next week in the Allahabad High Court.
  • An FIR was filed by Atul's brother, Bikas Kumar, accusing Nikita and her family of abetment of suicide.
  • Atul Subhash, a 34-year-old software engineer, left behind a suicide note and video alleging harassment by his wife and her family.
  • The incident has sparked a debate on social media regarding the treatment of men in legal cases related to divorce and alimony.
  • A public interest litigation has been filed in the Supreme Court regarding the misuse of dowry and domestic violence laws against men.
His video and suicide note have sparked a debate on social media, with many calling for the arrest of Nikita and her family members.

This case raises significant issues regarding the legal battles surrounding marriage and the societal pressures linked to them, highlighting the need for attention to mental health and legal equity.
